intro: Ornithogalum ostrovicense, commonly known as the Socotra lily, is a striking plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall flowering stem. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and protected species.
